entry.title: GitHub Command Line Push Errors?
entry.content:
If you use Octopress for github pages like every other nerd out there, then you have likely encountered an issue recently: you create a new page and do a rake generate and rake deploy and the username and password don’t seem to work. Specifically, it bombs with a fatal: Authentication failed error.

To fix this problem, see this SO article and this GitHub FAQ.

entry.title: Goodies for Today
entry.content: Just discovered Mapbox.js. It is an absolutely delightful way for incorporating maps into your web-based applications.

entry.title: GIMP Use Cases for Photographers
entry.content:
I found GIMP 2.8 useful for the following workflow tasks that typical photographers will want:

  • Contrast mask
  • Image sharpening (using <Image>-Filters-Enhance-Sharpen or <Image>-Filters-Enhance-Unsharp mask)
  • Smart sharpening (when you don’t want that silly look that comes from sharpening everything)
  • Color balancing
  • Correcting muddy pictures (auto levels)
  • Correcting blemishes (scratches and other artifacts)

entry.title: Awesome Way to Back Up Your MBPs Into Your Ubuntu Machine
entry.content: Been using netatalk to setup a time machine server on a Ubuntu 12.04 machine serving up space from an external HDD. Works well!

entry.title: Begun Using Octopress. Feature-lean
entry.content: I’ve begun using Octopress! I think the best way to describe it is that it feels like it is feature-lean, but it is quite lean and nerdy way to blog.
